etymologies: late Middle English: from Old French reporter (verb), report (noun), from Latin reportare ‘bring back’, from re- ‘back’ + portare ‘carry’. The sense ‘give an account’ gave rise to ‘submit a formal report’, hence ‘inform an authority of one's presence’ (report (sense 2 of the verb), mid 19th century) and ‘be accountable to a superior’ (report (sense 3 of the verb), late 19th century)

definitions: give a spoken or written account of something that one has observed, heard, done, or investigated

examples.text: the representative reported a decline in milk and meat production
police reported that the flood waters were abating
the teacher should report on the child's progress

shortDefinitions: give spoken or written account of something

definitions: cover an event or subject as a journalist or a reporter

examples.text: the public disliked the way that the media reported on the scandal
the Egyptian news agency reported that a coup attempt had taken place
the paper reported a secret program by the country to build nuclear warheads

shortDefinitions: cover event or subject as journalist or reporter

definitions: used to indicate that something has been stated, although one cannot confirm its accuracy

examples.text: these hoaxers are reported to be hacking into airline frequencies to impersonate air traffic controllers

shortDefinitions: used to indicate that something has been stated

definitions: make a formal statement or complaint about (someone or something) to the necessary authority

examples.text: undisclosed illegalities are reported to the company's directors
eight horses have been reported missing in the last month

shortDefinitions: make formal statement or complaint about person or thing to necessary authority

definitions: (of a legislative committee) formally announce that the committee has dealt with (a bill)

examples.text: the Chairman shall report the Bill to the House

shortDefinitions: formally announce that committee has dealt with

definitions: present oneself formally as having arrived at a particular place or as ready to do something

examples.text: Stewart is to report to a probation office on Monday
he was given only a few days to say goodbye to his family and report for duty

shortDefinitions: present oneself formally as having arrived

definitions: be responsible to (a superior or supervisor)

examples.text: he reports to the chairman of the committee

definitions: an account given of a particular matter, especially in the form of an official document, after thorough investigation or consideration by an appointed person or body

examples.text: the chairman's annual report

definitions: a spoken or written description of an event or situation, especially one intended for publication or broadcast in the media

examples.text: press reports suggested that the government was still using secret police to help maintain public order

shortDefinitions: spoken or written description of event

definitions: a teacher's written assessment of a student's work, progress, and conduct, issued at the end of a term or academic year.
shortDefinitions: teacher's written assessment of pupil's work

definitions: a detailed formal account of a case heard in a court, giving the main points in the judgment, especially as prepared for publication.
shortDefinitions: detailed formal account of case heard in court

definitions: a piece of information that is unsupported by firm evidence and that the speaker feels may or may not be true

examples.text: reports were circulating that the chairman was about to resign

shortDefinitions: piece of information that is unsupported by firm evidence

examples.text: report has it that the beetles have now virtually disappeared

definitions: a sudden loud noise of or like an explosion or gunfire

examples.text: all our horses are very gentle and are accustomed to hearing the report of a .22

shortDefinitions: sudden loud noise of or like explosion or gunfire

definitions: an employee who is supervised by another employee

examples.text: all of his reports are twenty-somethings with no concept of proper attire for work

shortDefinitions: employee who reports to another employee

definitions: the way in which someone or something is regarded; reputation

examples.text: whatsoever things are lovely and of good report
